item.title: Troubleshooting section
item.description: You can now find troubleshooting content for latency and throttling issues that might occur in your DynamoDB tables.

item.title: Deletion protection for Amazon DynamoDB
item.description: Deletion protection is now available for Amazon DynamoDB tables in all AWS Regions. DynamoDB now makes it possible for you to protect your tables from accidental deletion when performing regular table management operations.

item.title: AWS CloudFormation support for KDSD in global tables
item.description: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for DynamoDB now supports AWS CloudFormation for DynamoDB global tables, which means you can enable streaming to an Amazon Kinesis Data Streams on your DynamoDB global tables with CloudFormation templates.

item.title: DynamoDB local supports 100 actions per transaction
item.description: You can now perform up to 100 actions in a single transaction on DynamoDB local.

item.title: Using the DynamoDB Well-Architected Lens to optimize your DynamoDB workload
item.description: You can now use the DynamoDB Well-Architected Lens, a collection of design principles and guidance that you can use for designing well-architected DynamoDB workloads.

item.title: PartiQL GovGloud availability
item.description: PartiQLâ€”a SQL-compatible query language for Amazon DynamoDB is now supported in AWS GovCloud (US-East) and AWS GovCloud (US-West).

item.title: Single installation suite for NoSQL Workbench and DynamoDB local
item.description: NoSQL Workbench for DynamoDB now includes a guided DynamoDB local installation process to streamline setting up your DynamoDB local development environment.

item.title: Bulk import from S3
item.description: Amazon DynamoDB now makes it easier for you to migrate and load data into new DynamoDB tables by supporting bulk data imports from Amazon S3.

item.title: Enhanced integration with Service Quotas
item.description: Service Quotas now enables you to proactively manage your account and table quotas. You can view current values, set alarms for when your utilization of a quota exceeds a configurable threshold, and more.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench adds table and GSI support
item.description: You can now use NoSQL Workbench for table and global secondary index (GSI) control plane operations such as CreateTable, UpdateTable, and DeleteTable.

item.title: Standard-infrequent access table class now available in China
item.description: Amazon DynamoDB Standard-Infrequent Access table class is available in China Regions. Reduce your DynamoDB costs by up to 60 percent, by using this new table class for tables that store infrequently accessed data.

item.title: Increase in default service quotas and table management operations
item.description: DynamoDB increased the default quota for the number of tables per account and Region from 256 to 2,500 tables, and increased the number of concurrent table management operations from 50 to 500.

item.title: Optional limiting of items with PartiQL for DynamoDB
item.description: DynamoDB can limit the number of items processed in PartiQL for DynamoDB operations as an optional parameter on each request.

item.title: AWS Backup integration available in China (Beijing and Ningxia) Regions
item.description: AWS Backup now integrates with DynamoDB in the China (Beijing and Ningxia) Regions. You can meet compliance and business continuity requirements more easily through enhanced backup features in AWS Backup, such as cross-account and cross-Region backups.

item.title: Throughput capacity information through PartiQL API calls
item.description: DynamoDB can return the throughput capacity consumed by PartiQL API calls to help you optimize your queries and throughput costs.

item.title: AWS Backup integration
item.description: DynamoDB now helps you meet compliance and business continuity requirements more easily through enhanced backup features in AWS Backup, such as cross-account and cross-Region backups.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench import/export datasets in CSV
item.description: NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB now enables you to import and automatically populate sample data to help build and visualize your data models.

item.title: Filter and retrieve Amazon DynamoDB Streams data-plane activity with AWS CloudTrail
item.description: Amazon DynamoDB now provides you more granular control of audit logging by enabling you to filter Streams data-plane API activity in AWS CloudTrail.

item.title: Updated console
item.description: The DynamoDB console is now your default console to help you manage data more easily, simplify your common tasks, and give you faster access to resources and features.

item.title: DAX SDK For Java 2.x is now available
item.description: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) SDK for Java 2.x is now available and is compatible with the AWS SDK for Java 2.x. You can benefit from the latest features, including non-blocking I/O.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench feature updates including control plane operations
item.description: NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB now helps you run frequent operations more easily to modify and access table data.

item.title: DynamoDB global tables are now available in the Asia Pacific Region
item.description: DynamoDB global tables are now available in the Asia Pacific (Osaka) Region. Replicate your DynamoDB tables automatically across your choice of 22 AWS Regions.

item.title: DAX is now available in China
item.description: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) is now available in the China (Beijing) Region, operated by Sinnet.

item.title: DAX encryption in transit
item.description: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) now supports encryption in transit of data between your applications and DAX clusters, and between the nodes within a DAX cluster.

item.title: CloudFormation and CloudTrail integration
item.description: Integration with AWS CloudFormation and security enhancements with CloudFormation data-plane logging.

item.title: CloudFormation now supported for global tables
item.description: Amazon DynamoDB global tables now support AWS CloudFormation, which means you can create global tables and manage their settings with CloudFormation templates.

item.title: Amazon DynamoDB local support for Java 2.x
item.description: You now can use the AWS SDK for Java 2.x with DynamoDB local, the downloadable version of Amazon DynamoDB. With DynamoDB local, you can develop and test applications by using a version of DynamoDB running in your local development environment without incurring any additional costs.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench now supports AWS CloudFormation
item.description: NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB now supports AWS CloudFormation, so you can manage and modify DynamoDB data models with CloudFormation templates. In addition, you now can configure table capacity settings in NoSQL Workbench.

item.title: DynamoDB and AWS Amplify now feature integration
item.description: AWS Amplify now orchestrates multiple DynamoDB global secondary index updates in a single deployment.

item.title: AWS CloudTrail to log Amazon DynamoDB Streams data-plane APIs
item.description: You now can use AWS CloudTrail to log Amazon DynamoDB Streams data-plane API activity, and monitor and investigate item-level changes in your DynamoDB tables.

item.title: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for Amazon DynamoDB now supports AWS CloudFormation
item.description: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for Amazon DynamoDBnow supports AWS CloudFormation, which means you can enable streaming to an Amazon Kinesis data stream on your DynamoDB tables with CloudFormation templates. By streaming your DynamoDB data changes to a Kinesis data stream, you can build advanced streaming applications with AAmazon Kinesis services.

item.title: Amazon Keyspaces now offers FIPS 140-2 compliant endpoints
item.description: Amazon Keyspaces (for Apache Cassandra) now offers Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) 140-2 compliant endpoints to help you run highly regulated workloads more easily. FIPS 140-2 is a US and Canadian government standard that specifies the security requirements for cryptographic modules that protect sensitive information.

item.title: Amazon EC2 T3 instances for DAX
item.description: DAX now supports Amazon EC2 T3 instance types, which provide a baseline level of CPU performance with the ability to burst above the baseline when needed.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB support for PartiQL
item.description: You now can use the NoSQL Workbench for DynamoDB to build PartiQL statements for DynamoDB.

item.title: PartiQL for DynamoDB
item.description: You now can use PartiQL for DynamoDBâ€”a SQL-compatible query languageâ€”to interact with DynamoDB tables and run ad hoc queries by using the AWS Management Console, AWS Command Line Interface, and DynamoDB APIs for PartiQL.

item.title: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for Amazon DynamoDB
item.description: You now can use Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for Amazon DynamoDB with your DynamoDB tables to capture item-level changes and replicate them to a Kinesis data stream.

item.title: DynamoDB table export
item.description: You can now export your DynamoDB tables to Amazon S3, enabling you to perform analytics and complex queries on your data with services like Athena, AWS Glue, and Lake Formation.

item.title: Support for empty values
item.description: DynamoDB now supports empty values for non-key String and Binary attributes in DynamoDB tables. Empty value support gives you greater flexibility to use attributes for a broader set of use cases without having to transform such attributes before sending them to DynamoDB. List, Map, and Set data types also support empty String and Binary values.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB support for Linux
item.description: NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB is now supported on Linux- Ubuntu , Fedora and Debian.

item.title: CloudWatch Contributor Insights for DynamoDB â€“ GA
item.description: CloudWatch Contributor Insights for DynamoDB is generally available. CloudWatch Contributor Insights for DynamoDB is a diagnostic tool that provides an at-a-glance view of your DynamoDB table's traffic trends and helps you identify your table's most frequently accessed keys (also known as hot keys).

item.title: Upgrading global tables
item.description: You now can update your global tables from version 2017.11.29 to the latest version of global tables (2019.11.21), with a few clicks in the DynamoDB Console. By upgrading the version of your global tables, you can increase the availability of your DynamoDB tables easily by extending your existing tables into additional AWS Regions, with no table rebuilds required.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB â€“ GA
item.description: NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB is generally available. Use the NoSQL Workbench to design, create, query, and manage DynamoDB tables.

item.title: DAX cache cluster metrics
item.description: DAX support for new CloudWatch metrics, that allow you to better understand your DAX cluster's performance.

item.title: CloudWatch Contributor Insights for DynamoDB â€“ Preview
item.description: CloudWatch Contributor Insights for DynamoDB is a diagnostic tool that provides an at-a-glance view of your DynamoDB table's traffic trends and helps you identify your table's most frequently accessed keys (also known as hot keys).

item.title: Adaptive capacity support for imbalanced workload
item.description: Amazon DynamoDB adaptive capacity now handles imbalanced workloads better by isolating frequently accessed items automatically. If your application drives disproportionately high traffic to one or more items, DynamoDB will rebalance your partitions such that frequently accessed items do not reside on the same partition.

item.title: Support for customer managed keys
item.description: DynamoDB now supports customer managed keys, which means you can have full control over how you encrypt and manage the security of your DynamoDB data.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench support for DynamoDB local (Downloadable Version)
item.description: The NoSQL Workbench now supports connecting to DynamoDB local (Downloadable Version) to design, create, query, and manage DynamoDB tables.

item.title: NoSQL Workbench - Preview
item.description: This is the initial release of NoSQL Workbench for DynamoDB. Use NoSQL Workbench to design, create, query, and manage DynamoDB tables. For more information, see NoSQL Workbench for Amazon DynamoDB (Preview).

item.title: DAX adds support for transactional operations using Python and .NET
item.description: DAX supports the TransactWriteItems and TransactGetItems APIs for applications written in Go, Java, .NET, Node.js, and Python. For more information, see In-Memory Acceleration with DAX.

item.title: Amazon DynamoDB local (Downloadable Version) Updates
item.description: DynamoDB local (Downloadable Version) now supports transactional APIs, on-demand read/write capacity, capacity reporting for read and write operations, and 20 global secondary indexes. For more information, see Differences Between Downloadable DynamoDB and the DynamoDB Web Service.

item.title: Amazon DynamoDB On-Demand
item.description: DynamoDB on-demand is a flexible billing option capable of serving thousands of requests per second without capacity planning. DynamoDB on-demand offers pay-per-request pricing for read and write requests so that you pay only for what you use. For more information, see Read/Write Capacity Mode.

item.title: Amazon DynamoDB Transactions
item.description: DynamoDB transactions make coordinated, all-or-nothing changes to multiple items both within and across tables, providing atomicity, consistency, isolation, and durability (ACID) in DynamoDB. For more information, see Amazon DynamoDB Transactions.

item.title: Amazon DynamoDB encrypts all customer data at rest
item.description: DynamoDB encryption at rest provides an additional layer of data protection by securing your data in the encrypted table, including its primary key, local and global secondary indexes, streams, global tables, backups, and DAX clusters whenever the data is stored in durable media. For more information, see Amazon DynamoDB Encryption at Rest.

item.title: Use Amazon DynamoDB Local More Easily with the New Docker Image
item.description: Now, itâ€™s easier to use DynamoDB local, the downloadable version of DynamoDB, to help you develop and test your DynamoDB applications by using the new DynamoDB local Docker image. For more information, see DynamoDB (Downloadable Version) and Docker.

item.title: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) Adds Support for Encryption at Rest
item.description: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) now supports encryption at rest for new DAX clusters to help you accelerate reads from Amazon DynamoDB tables in security-sensitive applications that are subject to strict compliance and regulatory requirements. For more information, see DAX Encryption at Rest.

item.title: DynamoDB point-in-time recovery (PITR) adds support for restoring deleted tables
item.description: If you delete a table with point-in-time recovery enabled, a system backup is automatically created and is retained for 35 days (at no additional cost). For more information, see Before You Begin Using Point In Time Recovery.

item.title: Updates now available over RSS
item.description: You can now subscribe to the RSS feed (at the top left corner of this page) to receive notifications about updates to the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.
